resources.string: Menu commands
Contextual actions
The menu for contextual actions gets displayed by long tapping on a list entry.
Form fields
Delete the selected items.
Edit the selected item.
Transaction list
This screen lists all transactions for the current account. Use the floating action button to open the form for creating a new transaction.
Long press on the floating action button opens a menu that allows to prepare the form for transfer, split transaction or income.
Tapping on the toolbar (account label or current balance) pops up a menu with the following entries:
Copy the current balance to the clipboard.
Calculate the difference between the current balance and a new value.
The status of the transaction is indicated by a colored rectangle: gray for unreconciled, blue for clear, green for reconciled. Clicking on the rectangle, changes the status.

This command will export all transactions of the current account to a file on the SD card in QIF or CSV format. You can decide to delete the exported transactions, in that case the opening balance is automatically adjusted. Alternatively, if transactions are not deleted, they will be marked as exported. My Expenses can share the file immediately after the export through FTP, email or any other file sharing app, if you configure it to do so in the Settings. If a search filter is active, only the transactions mapped by this filter will be taken into consideration.

You can group transactions by day, week, month or year. For each group, the sum of income, expenses and transfers is calculated and displayed. When you click on a group header, the group of transactions is collapsed and only the header is displayed. Click again to expand.
Transactions can be sorted in ascending (oldest on top) or descending (latest on top) direction.
Display the distribution of your expenses per category. You can also long click on a group header to inspect the distribution for a specific period of time.
Manage daily, weekly, monthly or yearly budgets for the currently displayed account.
Display a cash flow diagram: How did your expense and income evolve over days, weeks, months or years?
Opens the list of templates and plans, where you can apply, edit or delete them, and also define plans for future and recurrent transactions.

This command opens a dialog displaying the last reconciled balance and the cleared balance. You can compare the latter to your bank statement, and mark all cleared transactions as reconciled. Optionally you can decide to delete reconciled transactions.
Generates a printable view of the transactions currently displayed.

This entry opens a submenu which allows you to define search criteria based on category, amount, comment, status, payer/payee and payment method. When a search filter is active, you can simply click on its entry in the submenu to deactivate it.
Define a new template based on the selected transaction. Will prompt you for the title of the template.
The selected transactions will be cloned with the current date and time. You can make changes before saving the copy.
You can later edit the transaction to create additional parts as needed.
Activate scan mode in order to quickly scan receipts.
An expense in one account can be linked with an income in another account. If the accounts have the same currency, the two transactions must have identical amounts.
This screen lists the predefined payment methods (Cheque, Credit card, Deposit, Direct debit) and lets you define new ones. Use the floating action button to open the form for creating a new method.
This screen lists the parties used for the autocompletion of the Payer/Payee field.
Select a party by tapping on it.
Select all the parties that you want to use for filtering the transaction list.
Use the floating action button to add a new entry.
Use the floating action button to confirm the selection.
Select the duplicate parties that you want to merge.
You will be prompted to select which variant to keep.
If the same party appears multiple times in the list with different spelling variations, you can merge them together.
Plan calendar view
Upcoming recurrences

While templates can be derived from transactions through their context menu, here you can create new templates from scratch (for transactions or transfers) by clicking on the floating action button. Clicking on a template, will create an instance for it.
A plan is a template for which you have created an event (one-time or recurring) in the planner calendar. Clicking on a plan, will open a calendar view, which displays past and upcoming instances of a plan.
Long tapping on an open instance starts multi-selection. Tapping on the start or end of the date range allows to extend the range into the past or the future.
Each highlighted date represents an instance of the plan.
The state of an instance is indicated by the following icons:
The instance has not yet been applied.
The instance has been applied.
The instance has been cancelled, i.e. you have flagged it to be skipped. No transaction will be created for this instance.
Instantiate the selected templates and save them immediately.
Instantiate the selected template and enter its editing form where you can modify it before saving.
Delete the selected templates and any associated plans.
Edit the selected template and create or edit an associated plan.
Create transactions at the time of the selected event instances and save them immediately.
Create a transaction at the time of the selected event instance and enter its editing form where you can modify it before saving.
Indicate that at the selected event instances, no transactions should be created. If transactions have been created for the selected event instances, they will be deleted.
If transactions have been created for the selected event instances, they will be deleted, if they have been flagged as cancelled, the flags are removed.
Edit the transaction that has been created for the selected plan instance.
The template list can be sorted by title (alphabetically), by amount, by frequency of usages, or by the last time a transaction was instantiated from it.

This screen displays the distribution of your expenses and incomes per categories, for all transactions in an account, or for a specific group. If you expand a main category in the list, the pie chart will display the distribution of its subcategories. If you select a category in the list, it will be highlighted in the pie chart, and vice-versa. Long press on a category in order to display an aggregated list of the transactions mapped to it.

In addition to the actions that you can perform when managing categories from the Preferences screen (create, edit, delete), on this screen you map a transaction to a selected category by simply clicking on it.
Click on an entry for starting multi-selection.

This screen allows to create, edit and delete categories. By default, the primary sort criteria in the category list is the number of times you use a category (the secondary criteria is alphabetical order). This gives you quick access to the categories you use most often.
Click on the / icon to expand or collapse a category.
Click on an entry for showing its context menu. Long tap for starting multi-selection.
Set the type of grouping and display the distribution per day, month, week or year.
Navigate to the previous group. Can also be done through swipe gesture from left to right.
Navigate to the next group. Can also be done through swipe gesture from right to left.
Opens the dialog for creating a new sub-category below the selected category. Sub-categories can be nested with arbitrary depth.
Any category (together with its sub-categories) can be moved to a new parent category. Sub-categories can be transformed to main categories.
Categories of the same type can be merged.
A set of default categories will be imported.
Categories will be exported to QIF file.
Toggle the visibility of the chart.
The selected categories will be used for filtering the transaction list.
Only main and sub categories which match your query will be displayed.
The category list can be sorted by title (alphabetically), by frequency of usages, or by the last time a transaction was mapped to it.
You can assign a color to main categories. This color will be used to represent the category in charts. Subcategories will use shades of their main category\'s color.
Form for transactions
Form for transfers
Form for splits
Form for category split parts
Form for transfer split parts
Form for transaction templates
Form for transfer templates
Form for split templates
Use this form to enter a new transaction or to edit an existing one. Use the dropdown menu in the actionbar to switch to the form for adding a new transfer or split transaction.
Use this form to enter a new template or to edit an existing one. Use the dropdown menu in the actionbar to switch between templates for transactions, transfers and splits.
A split transaction is a single transaction split up in parts, where each part can be assigned to a different category, or transferred to a different account.
Select the account to which the transaction belongs.
Enter the date and time when the transaction took place.
In the settings you can disable time input and enable differentiation between booking date and value date.
If the / toggle is in its linked state, setting either value date or booking date will also update the other date.
This field remembers the values you enter and will suggest them in the future.
Use the switch to toggle between expense and income.
The button opens the calculator.

For transactions belonging to bank accounts, you can change the transaction\'s status to cleared. For setting it to reconciled, you must use the \"Balance account\" command from the transaction list. If the status is set to void, the transaction will not be counted.
Enter any note about the object.

This field is only available if the current account is of a type linked to any payment method. By default only bank accounts are linked to payment methods (cheque,credit card, deposit,direct debit). Go to Settings -> Manage -> Payment Methods to configure the association between account types and payment methods. When you select a method that is defined as numbered, an additional field for entering a reference number becomes available.
The button allows you to attach an image (e.g. from the gallery or the camera) to the object.

For each template, you can configure if a short tap on it in the template list will either save the instance immediately or enter its editing form where you can modify it before saving. You can always access both actions through a long tap.
This button opens the list of categories, where you can select the category you want to map to the transaction.
Use the + icon for entering as many split parts as needed.

The amount field will be automatically updated with the sum of the parts, unless you manually enter an amount, in which case the difference between the sum of the parts and the amount (unsplit amount) will be shown.
You can only save the split transaction, if the transaction amount has been exactly assigned.
Select a category for this split part.
Assign the accounts where this object is transferred from or to.
You can specify the rate in either of the both directions of the transfer. The inverse rate and the amount corresponding to the dependent part of the exchange rate are calculated automatically.
Enter a title that uniquely identifies the template.
When you create a plan for a template, it is added to a private calendar handled by your Calendar app. You can define the plan as a one-time event, or as recurring daily, weekly, monthly or yearly.
After you have saved the template, you can configure more advanced types of recurrence making use of your calendar app.

A plan can be set to automatic or manual. When an instance of an automatic plan occurs, the transaction will be created, and you receive a notification. When the plan is manual, you also receive a notification, which leaves the choice of canceling, modifying or applying the template to you.
Save the data and close the form.
If this is checked, after you save the data, the form is left open for creating a new transaction with the same data.

Show a field that allows to define an additional amount. For example if you pay with your credit card in a foreign currency, you can remember the original price in addition to the amount debited from your card. The original amount is ignored for calculating sums.
For calculating a grand total across all accounts, transactions of foreign currency accounts, are multiplied by an exchange rate that you set for the account.
Invert the direction of the transfer by swapping \'From\' and \'To\' account.
If the currencies of \'From\' and \'To\' account are different, you specify the amount for only one of them. The other one will be calculated when you create instances from the template.

This field allows to specify either a positive saving goal or a negative credit limit. In either case, on the account list, a progress indicator visualizes the distance between the current balance and the goal or the limit.
Open a menu that lists all templates allowing to quickly load them into the form.
If this is checked, the transaction will also be saved as template. You can define its title and optionally set a plan for automatic recurrence.
Form for accounts
The label identifies the account in the account list.
The description has only an informative purpose.
Use the switch to start with a negative opening balance.
Select a currency from the provided list of all current currencies.

You can define the type of an account as one of Cash, Bank, Asset, Liabilities, Credit Card. The type determines the available payment methods that you can configure under Settings -> Manage -> Payment Methods.

The reconciliation feature is available for all but cash accounts: It allows to set a transactions\' status to cleared, once it is confirmed, and reconcile the whole account with your bank statement through the \"Balance account\" command.
On the transaction list for an account, its color will be used as primary user interface color.
Select a backend for cloud synchronization.
Backends can be added from the Settings screen.
You can associate one ore more active tags with every account. When you create a new transaction, it is automatically tagged with those, based on the selected account.
If you check this option, this account will not be included into the aggregates per currency.
Form for payment methods
The label identifies the method when you map a transaction to it.
Through a method\'s type, you determine if it is applicable for expenses (debit), income (credit) or both (neutral).
When a method is numbered, transactions that are mapped to it, will have an additional field for entering a reference number.
Select the account types for which this method is applicable.

For each currency, you can modify the number of fraction digits used. For example, if for Euro, you need to handle 1/10 of a ¢, i.e. 1/1000 of a Euro, you would set the number to three. Existing accounts which use the currency, will be switched to the new setting.
You can also configure the currency symbol, which is used when amounts in a specific currency are formatted.
For custom currencies, you additionally define a label, which is shown in menus for selecting a currency, and an alphabetic code, which by convention consists of three characters.

This screen allows you to deal with image files that have been left over from deleted transactions. Long click on entries in order to either delete them, or move them out of the (possibly internal) storage folder to a backup folder (%s) on external storage.

After you select the file you want to import, you need to configure how the file is encoded (UTF-8 or ISO-8859-1), which character separates fields (comma, semicolon or tab), and how dates are formated. Data can be either imported into an existing account, or a new one, where you can configure the currency and the account type.

After you hit the Parse button from the action bar, the data will be presented you in a table. Before triggering the import through the button in the action bar, you can select rows that you want to discard, and you have to map the columns to the respective data fields.

When you discard the first row, you are prompted if you want it to be treated as a header line, in which case My Expenses will try to automatically map the columns based on the content of the header cells. It will also remember your mapping based on the header line, and restore it, when you import a file with the same header format the next time.

Text can be quoted using single quotes (\') to avoid interpretation. \'\' (two single quotes) represent a single quote. Consult the full specification for more details, or contact support@myexpenses.mobi for help.
The account list allows you to easily navigate between accounts by simply clicking on an entry.
Create a new account. The free version is limited to five accounts.
By closing an account, you can prevent any changes (additions, deletions, edits) to its data, but still allow it to be taken into consideration for all statistical calculations.

My Expenses allows to configure different synchronization backends for each account. For example, you can sync one account with a shared folder, while you sync another account with a private folder. On this screen you add or remove synchronization backends, start or stop synchronization with accounts available remotely. While synchronization happens automatically in a periodic manner, here you can also manually trigger it with a backend. Please be aware that My Expenses needs full control over the remote folder. You should not use other tools or interfaces for changing its contents, since this will most likely lead to failures during synchronization.

If your cloud storage provider supports this protocol, My Expenses will be able to sync data with it. Simply provide the URL to a folder with your username and password. If you use https and your webserver uses a self-signed certificate, you will be able to trust it explicitly.
Pick any folder that you own or that is shared with you.

For every backend, you can set a different passphrase for encrypting the synchronization data. You cannot switch an existing backend from unencrypted to encrypted. You need to recreate a new backend in that case. If you use the feature of storing auto-backups on the synchronization backend, these files are not encrypted with the backend specific password. Instead you can set a password that applies to all backup files, in the Security section of the Settings Screen.

This option allows to select a folder via Android\'s File Picker Dialogue. It is mainly useful if you have installed a cloud storage app that supports selecting a folder for storing content, like NextCloud does.
From the submenu select the type of synchronization backend that you want to add, and provide the details specific to each.
Trigger immediate synchronization with the selected backend.
Remove the selected backend.
Download an account that is available on the backend. An account will be created locally and be configured for synchronization with the backend.
Start synchronization for an account that exists both locally and remotely. You need to decide if local or remote data should be kept on the first synchronization.
The selected account will no longer be synced to the backend
This screen displays your cash flow, how your expenses and income evolve over years, months, weeks or days.
Switch between daily, weekly, monthly or annual grouping of your cash flow data.
Toggle the visibility of the balance.
Toggle, if transfers should be treated like a regular income or expense.

By defining a budget, you define an overall amount that you want to spend during a given period. You can also allocate amounts for categories and sub-categories. You then monitor how much you have spent and how much remains to be spent.
Clicking on the budgeted amounts allows to change them.
Changing an amount will never affect past periods. Unless you decide to only set it for the current period, it will affect future periods.
Clicking on the spent amounts lists all the transactions relevant for the current budget and the corresponding category.
Open a dialog listing all transactions mapped to the selected category in the current account.
Compare budget with spending of past and future periods of time.
Change the budget\'s definition.
By activating this option, only categories, for which some amount has been allocated, are displayed.
The currently displayed budget will be deleted.

If you underspend or overspend on your budget, you can rollover the difference to the next period, so that the amount that you can allocate there is either increased or decreased. There are three options:
Only the remainder for the total budget is rolled over, so that only the total budget of the next period is increased or decreased.
The remainder for each category is rolled over, and the corresponding allocation in the next period will be affected.
This option allows you to precisely configure the rollover. For example, you can set partial rollovers only for some categories or sub-categories, and rollover the remaining part on the total budget.
List of all budgets
This screen shows a summary of all budgets you have created. Use the floating action button to create a new budget. Clicking on a list entry displays a single budget.
Form for budgets
Use this form to create a new budget or to edit an existing one.
A budget\'s title helps identifying it in the budget list.
How much money is available in the context of this budget.
A budget is either limited to one account; it covers all accounts with the same currency; or it refers to the total aggregate across all currencies.
Budgets can be filtered with respect to categories, parties, methods or states. Only transactions matched by these filters are taken into account.

A budget is defined as either regular (daily, monthly, weekly, annual) or one-time. For one-time budgets, you specify the beginning and the end of its duration. A regular budget (that is not filtered) can be set as default: This means that the transaction list (if it is configured to group data per day, week, month or year) will show the progress for this budget for each period.
Use the commands in this submenu, if you want to change the given property (account, category, payer/payee or payment method) for all selected transactions.
The + icon allows to select existing tags and to create new tags. The x icon on each tag allows to remove the mapping between the transaction and the tag.
Select or unselect the tags for filtering the transaction list by tapping on them.
Create new tags by entering them into the text field.
Map or unmap the tags by tapping on them. Use the floating action button to confirm the mapping.
Tap on the icon to edit, assign a color to, or delete a tag.
Associate debts with parties, inspect list of transactions and calculate remaining balance.

This submenu allows to define new debts associated with the selected party, and to manage existing debts: to inspect the transaction history and the remaining balance and to edit, close or delete them.
The label allows to select the debt on the form for transactions, in order to mark a transaction as a down payment.

Enter the original amount of the debt. Transactions linked to the debt will decrease or increase the balance. Use the switch to distinguish between debts you owe and debts that are owed to you. If you select a currency other than your home currency, the debt will only be visible in accounts with the same currency.
Enter the date when the debt was incurred.

This screen allows you to select the data that you want to sync between the device and the backend. It lists all the accounts on your device that are not yet synced to other backends, and all accounts stored on the backend. Clicking on / will select or unselect an account for synchronization. If you select an account that already exists both locally and remotely, you need to decide if initially the data on your device should override the existing data on the backend, or the other way round.

With this option you customize the tap on a category that has child categories: If it is checked, a short tap will select the category; if it is unchecked, a short tap will expand / collapse the category. In the latter case, selection is available from the context menu.
Map the selected category to the transaction and return to the transaction form.
Call the URL displayed in the subtitle from a web browser on your desktop computer.
Currently the web user interface does not support transfers or split transactions.
You can set a password to protect access. In the dialogue presented by the web browser, only password is taken into account, username is ignored.
When displaying transactions for the selected account, the web user interface will use the same filters that you have set with the app on the Android device.
Multi-selection can be started by selecting this command, or by long tapping on a list entry.
Click on an entry in order to expand / collapse.
For each debt, use the menu in the top right corner in order to edit, close, delete or share it. Foreign currency debts can optionally be listed with equivalent amounts in the home currency.
Debts that have been closed or paid off (their balance is 0), will only be shown, if this option is checked.
When this option is activated, you can select to only show expense, income or transfer categories.

Transactions mapped to income categories are always counted as income, transactions mapped to expense categories are always counted as expense. This option allows you to configure how transactions mapped to neutral categories are counted: By default if they are positive they represent an income, if they are negative an expense. But if this option is activated, they are always included into both the sums of your income and expense.
Search for transactions with same properties.

After selecting a date range, all transactions for this period will be rolled up into a summary archive transaction. This will clear up the transaction list, but the transactions in the archive can still be inspected, and, if needed, unpacked again.
The budget list can be grouped either by account or by type of budget.

Foreign currency accounts can be configured to use dynamic exchange rates. For every day you can either download or enter a specific rate relative to your home currency. This screen lists stored rates for a given currency for every day back to the date of the oldest transaction. The source of the rate is indicated as follows:
Download the rate for the given date from the configured provider. Some providers will not provide rates for every date, e.g. for week ends or public holidays, and instead return an earlier rate.
Manually enter the rate for the given date. The user provided rate has priority over downloaded rates.
If a foreign currency account is configured to use dynamic exchange rates, you can set a specific equivalent amount for every transaction.
The current value of a foreign currency account with dynamic exchange rates is calculated based on the most recent exchange rate.
The option %s allows you to track the up-to-date net worth of all your accounts.
This rate has been provided by the user while editing the equivalent amount of a transaction.
This rate has been calculated automatically from existing rates, when the home currency was reconfigured.

With this option checked, you can see how each foreign currency account contributes to the grand total in your home currency. If an account does not use dynamic exchange rates, its value is calculated based on the rate set in the account’s properties. Otherwise:
The initial value is based on the rate set in the account’s properties.
Income and expense sums are calculated using the equivalent amounts specified for each transaction.
The current value is based on the latest exchange rate for the account’s currency.

Columns can be resized by dragging the black rectangle between columns. The icons and allow to add new columns. Fields can be dragged, and either dropped to a new position or to the recycle area. If you drop a field onto another field, you create a combined field, i.e. the two fields will be printed together on one line.

Account types classify accounts as 
• Assets (something you own, such as cash, bank accounts, or investments) or as 
• Liabilities (something you owe, such as credit cards or loans). 
You can add custom types and set their order, which mainly affects how they appear on the balance sheet.

Flags let you configure an account’s visibility and priority: 
• Hide rarely used accounts, while still choosing whether invisible accounts are included in aggregate accounts and the balance sheet. 
• Prioritize favorite accounts in the account selection on the transaction form. 
You can also use flags to indicate accounts belonging to a specific purpose, like household versus personal accounts, and then alternatively only show one or the other.

"The balance sheet shows the net worth of all your accounts as the difference between your Assets (what you own) and your Liabilities (what you owe). It reflects your financial position at a chosen moment — whether in the past, the present, or even in the future. The balance sheet presentation is also influenced by flags (which can change the inclusion of accounts in totals)."
Assign a flag to the selected account, e.g. Favorite or Inactive.
